description: The Grisaia no Rakuen visual novel continues the Grisaia no Meikyuu visual novel's main route and concludes the trilogy. It also includes a prologue following the five heroines as they arrive at Mihama Academy.

title.native: グリザイアの楽園 グリザイアの特典
グリザイア：ファントムトリガー THE ANIMATION
グリザイアの楽園 －サンクチュアリフェローズ－

name.native: ミリエラ・スタンフィールド

node.description:
Former adult game scenario writer. He is a creator of cult classic Shizuku, Kizuato and To Heart.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/t_takahasi)

Website Satou Tenshou is a Japanese animator, formerly belonging to Studio Wanpack, now a member of White Fox. His favourite anime are Sennen Joyuu, Kidou Senshi Gundam: Gyakushuu no Char, and Onegai Teacher. His nickname is MacGuyver. Having only served as an animator since Gad Guard he has shown to be proficient at displaying flowing stuff and its linework as well as excelling at storyboarding and portraying a good sense of camera action.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/64664693)

Yamamoto's interest in working in the anime industry piqued in high school after realizing how noticeable the difference in episodes were depending on the episode director in charge. One of his favourites shows included [Seisenshi Dunbine](https://anilist.co/anime/929/).

In the late '80s, he joined [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/) as a production assistant after finding out that it's how many of the studio's directors started off. There he met and studied under [Shuuji Iuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/115833/) on his shows [Madou King Granzort](https://anilist.co/anime/2818/) and [Mashin Eiyuuden Wataru](https://anilist.co/anime/4807/). Then after having gone freelance he got his first shot as a director as one of the three unit directors on Iuchi's [Ranma ½ film](https://anilist.co/anime/418/) in 1991.

In 2001, Yamamoto made his debut as a series director on [Shiawase Sou no Okojo-san](https://anilist.co/anime/2934/), soon after which he worked as the first director of the long-running [Keroro Gunsou](https://anilist.co/anime/516/). In 2006 he directed the well-received [NHK ni Youkoso!](https://anilist.co/anime/1210/)

More recent directorial works of his include [Yama no Susume](https://anilist.co/anime/14355/) and [Shounen Maid](https://anilist.co/anime/21321/).
In March 2010, she graduated from Tokyo Animation College.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

__Associated Names:__ Poyoyon Rock (ぽよよんろっく), Poyoyon♥Rock (ぽよよん♥ろっく), Pucchin Purin

[Twitter (NSFW)](https://twitter.com/punipoyo)

A Japanese animator, character designer, and animation director currently living in Tokyo, Japan. He often goes by the pseudonym Poyoyon Rock.  He is also a member of the doujinshi circle Pokopii.  

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tensho_tw) | [Website](http://tenshohp.web.fc2.com/)

Representative director of [Bibury](https://anilist.co/studio/6180/). Often teams up with [Masayuki Nonaka](https://anilist.co/staff/116301/).

name.native: エレメンツ ガーデン

node.description:
__[Profile (Aria Entertainment)](https://www.ariamusic.co.jp/elements-garden/)__

A Japanese group of music composers, or a "music production brand" as they call themselves. They generally produce music for video games, anime and recording artists. They are attached to Aria Entertainment.

__Current Members:__ 
[Noriyasu Agematsu](https://anilist.co/staff/103633/Noriyasu-Agematsu) (Producer/Lyricist/Composer)
[Junpei Fujita](https://anilist.co/staff/110557/Junpei-Fujita) (Producer/Composer/Arranger)
[Hitoshi Fujima](https://anilist.co/staff/101273/Hitoshi-Fujima) (Composer/Arranger)
[Daisuke Kikuta](https://anilist.co/staff/147815/Daisuke-Kikuta) (Composer/Arranger)
[Seima Iwahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/146530/Seima-Iwahashi) (Composer/Arranger/Director)
[Ryutaro Fujinaga](https://anilist.co/staff/155960/Ryutaro-Fujinaga) (Lyricist/Composer)
[Ryota Tomaru](https://anilist.co/staff/140532/Ryota-Tomaru) (Composer/Arranger)
[Yuta Kasai](https://anilist.co/staff/259881/Yuuta-Kasai) (Composer/Arranger)
[Yusuke Takeda](https://anilist.co/staff/156645/Yusuke-Takeda) (Lyricist/Composer)
[Asuka Oda](https://anilist.co/staff/155968/Asuka-Oda) (Lyricist)
[Seima Kondou](https://anilist.co/staff/239286/Seima-Kondou) (Composer/Arranger)

__Former Members:__ 
Yasutomo Nakai (2005-2006)
[Masato Nakayama](https://anilist.co/staff/112097/Masato-Nakayama) (2007-2013)
[Evan Call](https://anilist.co/staff/119999/Evan-Call) (2012-2016)
Tomohiro Kita (2011-2016), Haruki Mori (2009-2018)
[Ryouta Suemasu](https://anilist.co/staff/155969/Ryouta-Suemasu) (2014-2019)
**Masato Takahashi** is a Japanese CG director and CG designer who also does photography.

__Height:__ 150 cm

[Fanclub](https://www.gokinjolno.jp/) | [Blog](http://nanjolno.jugem.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nanjolno) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nanjolno/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFJORT2GGeNsKKLCf3BqSEQ)

She was the vocalist of the band fripSide and graduated in April 2022 with the fripSide Phase 2 Final Arena Tour. Likes cats, Final Fantasy XIV (even dubbed and sung the battle theme of Suzaku), and ramen.

**Non anime roles:**
- Soltina - Memento Mori (VG)
- Noise - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Topaz - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- Shu - Arknights (VG)
- Junah - Metaphor: ReFantazio (VG)
- Trigger - Zenless Zone Zero (VG)
Hidenori Kosuge is a production assistant.

__[Profile](http://www.ariamusic.co.jp/elements-garden/fujita/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Junpei_Fujita)__

Member of the "music production brand" Elements Garden.

His favourite anime are Sennen Joyuu, Kidou Senshi Gundam: Gyakushuu no Char, and Onegai Teacher. His nickname is MacGuyver. Having only served as an animator since Gad Guard he has shown to be proficient at displaying flowing stuff and its linework as well as excelling at storyboarding and portraying a good sense of camera action.

__Associated Names:__ Poyoyon Rock (ぽよよんろっく), Poyoyon♥Rock (ぽよよん♥ろっく), Pucchin Purin
